title: As I've mentioned in past questions, I've been feeling a lack in identity and purpose along with happiness feeling dulled. Some days seem to be better than other days however, but I'm still too nervous to see a professional. Any tips? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are uncertain about seeing a professional… then maybe think about SELF-HELP… You mention “lack of identity, and purpose along with happiness feeling dulled”… you also mention “nervous”…. “Lack of identity” can be a “dissociation, or depersonalization” sensation… where a person feels disconnectioned, and “not themselves”… I have had some of this myself. Derealization, is when the world and reality seem “SURREAL”… Loss of purpose, reason, goal, meaning, and value, can be depression issues, and indeed we often feel…”just plain LOST”… in depression.. I certainly did. Loss of happiness is depression is itself… a lack or loss of joy, or pleasure in things. “Nervous” is a stress response, and can also be an Anxiety issue…. Would you be interested in a SELF-HELP emotional technique for this? I have one… I use it on my PTSD… I went to doctors… got drugged…. that was it… I studied the mind in the 70s, took a course on psychosomatic phenomena, and events… much was about the subconscious and emotions… this technique I teach is based on much of that work. This is Psychology and emotional research based and supported research, practice, and experience over the last 130 years. If SELF-HELP… something you can start to do TODAY… would interest you… Let me tell you some things about emotions… this is what you are dealing with. Even if you have a medical problem… like me…. it can give you emotional issues. Have you had some shock and trauma in your life? That becomes emotional. Have you ever heard of Emotional Charge? It is a psychology term for ..”Bottled up emotions”… Emotion means… Energy in Motion… so when this energy gets bottled up, it gives us a pressure, and this pressure can build and give us stress. Anger is a stress emotion. So is Hate… Pain and Hurt as well…and it gives us a shock…if you look at an incident… there was probably a shock at the beginning of it… that then changed into your emotional responses… As I mentioned, “nervous” is a stress response, and it is an emotion… anxiousness is another one… but in the apprehension of Anxiety… Now… The energy of an emotion, has an amount, intensity, frequency, and polarity… Purpose-LESS… is seen as a negative polarity emotion. So, emotions have a Charge… just like electricity… and so… Purpose-LESS… would be an Emotional Charge… it is an Energy Load, on us… Purposeless is a depression range emotion… depression is about LOSS… less, and lack of… which is what you report. This would be your emotional charge… “I feel a loss of purpose”… right? Here is my podcast on Depression emotions, and one on “LESS-NESS”…the state of being without something… it is usually a part of depression. Podcast 0009 is on Depression Emotions and how the technique can help stop them. Happiness Is No Charge 0009 - Depression Emotions by Happiness Is No Charge • A podcast on Anchor Podcast 0010 is about emotions of "Less-ness", like "Hopeless" and feeling "Worthless", and how the technique can help stop them. Happiness Is No Charge 0010- Emotions of Less-ness by Happiness Is No Charge • A podcast on Anchor Feel free to listen to any other podcasts as well, there is one on stress… I have a video on Anxiety, message me if you would like to see it. Doing the technique addresses this Emotional Charge. It reduces it… it lessens, fades…and can stop… this is observable while you are doing the technique…there are 8 ways to tell the technique is working…one of them is… FEELING BETTER… no kidding… I have stopped my own Stress, Anxiety, and Depression Episodes with the technique, it even works on the emotions of a PAST episodes…Shock and negative emotions are stored up in MEMORY… “bottled up in memory” a reservoirs for emotions… I have PTSD… so I deal with Pressure, Stress, Anxiety, Hysteria, Depression and even suicidal issues at times. Many times this is FROM MEMORY… These are some things the technique works on... #suicidal thoughts, #flashbacks, #panic attacks, #Aggravation, #Anger, #Hate, #Hostility, #sadness, #grief, #guilt, #worthlessness, #hopelessness, #Fears #Stress, #Intimidation, #Shyness, #Worry, #Horror, #Terror, #Panic and MORE. The benefit to a person would be, the technique would take those down for them, and they would feel better… really… With my PTSD, I use the technique on all of those emotions listed above. This particular technique does not require a practitioner. You do the technique on your emotions… I could lead you to those emotions…but you already know them… right? So you might make a list of them… and then just do the technique on them, you don’t need me for that…and you can do this technique anywhere. I have done it while driving… even upset and driving. If you would like to know more about Emotional Charge, and the technique, feel free to visit my Quora Space page... just take your time, and go down the list of my posts to one you are interested in... I suggest starting with "How Energy Affects Us", and "What is Emotional Charge". There are posts on many topics, including depression, stress, and anxiety. Check it out. Steve Barham's post in Happiness Is No Charge I talk about the technique and how it can help things on my Space Page… that is for information… If you or anyone else, would like to learn the technique, I teach the technique in my book…”Target Your Emotions”. A book of my 10 years of research, practice and experience with using the technique. If you would like a copy, there are links to my work on the bottom of the Quora Space page. Best Wishes from a researcher who also has the problems he writes about… you can do something for your emotions… yourself… if you are not ready to seek professional help… this is not a bad way to go… people have gotten good benefit with the technique. You have nothing to lose…

Sometimes we need to look outside of ourselves to find ourselves. This could be finding your Faith or volunteering in an area that interests you. I have done both of these things and I have found that they have brought meaning and substance into my life. We can only concentrate on ourselves for so long until it starts to feel meaningless. We are meant to connect with God and others. I understand what you are speaking about. You lose that spark that makes life worth living. This Leads to you losing yourself because everything seems mundane and with no purpose. That is probably because it is. Finding that reason to get up in the morning is essential to our well being. I don’t mean just getting up to go to work. What I am speaking about is something that requires your attention externally that stirs you internally. It is great to focus on ourselves but that is a very small scope and can have you living in a very shallow manner. Purpose driven combined with passion is something that we should all be seeking in order to live a fulfilled life.

You would be best to seek help. Sometimes we can't make the changes we seek without a hand being held, without regularity of practices, without kindness, without accountability. If this has gone on a while ask yourself how much longer you are prepared to live like this. Have you reached the crossroads of pain yet when your choice is removed. Your nervousness is resistance. Don't let it win.

HI Marissa. First, I would address what you are most fearful of about seeing a professional? Take some time to ask yourself this question. Getting to the root of your fear helps. It sounds like you are ready to make some changes in your life. Feel free to learn about the First Essential Step To Making a Change in Your Life HERE. This is a FREE mini-training that will help you take one small step forward. Taking positive action that is healthy for you is important when you feel as though you may be stuck and lacking identity and purpose.

Find a professional don't be afraid. I was like you. If you believe in God find a good community that have people of your age to interact with. You will find people that you can talk too. I did that, I was like a zombie like with no feelings. I'm a changed man now with family and helping others like you and me to get up and find happiness.

Now I'm no professional whatsoever but remember why you wanna see a professional in the first place. So with you delaying the process means a chip of your good precious future life falls away. It's nerve wracking I know but trust me you'll feel much braver when you take the first step… Mr Mandela once said “it alway seems impossible until it's done" You got this!🌻

I don't know what to suggest, but I feel like that too. I don't want to be regarded as problematic so I don't ask for help. I'm also lonely even when I'm not alone. I can only say take one day at a time and don't be too harsh to yourself.
Get over your nerves and get professional help. The problem isn't ping to fix itself. Stop stalling and using any excuse you can create. Our know what you need, so go get it already
What is a lack of identity? Did you forget your name? You seem accustomed to silver platter service. Maybe you should look for an opportunity to do some serving.
If you're serious about finding your purpose and who you really are why waste time.. Find yourself a coach..
